data.text: @FriedrichHayek Bloods and crypts? Or are you referring to other gangs?  All these colors we use to define Americans is getting confusing.
@FriedrichHayek Poorer (not such good health); older (more susceptible). No mystery.
@FriedrichHayek Because Blue States have high Black populations that were anti-vaxx?

@FriedrichHayek Lack of health care. They are poor and shutdowns have hurt them disproportionately. They are generally older. They are generally less healthy (because they are poor). These causes are the same reason why they voted for Trump
@FriedrichHayek They’re older, fatter and poorer. Pretty easy explanation.
@FriedrichHayek I have never seen so many graphs that say so many different things. I would have to read every study to get a grip on the situation and unfortunately I don't have time
@FriedrichHayek NJ & NY were way way ahead in deaths per capita because of timing (dealt a bad hand). It’s really sad that MS and AL passed them at a point when most deaths are preventable.

@mrwillykillm @FriedrichHayek NJ & NY were way way ahead in deaths per capita because of timing (dealt a bad hand). It’s really sad that MS and AL passed them at a point where most deaths are preventable.
@FriedrichHayek Covid can’t kill you twice. The thousands who died in NYC and other liberal places during the first wave are not coming back to life.

@BreslauerKHB @FriedrichHayek Age is the biggest influence on
 COVID outcomes. Over 10,000 time more likely to die from COVID for over 70s Vs 15 or younger. Without that data everything is meaningless. https://t.co/pUDgdKJmIq
